name: Snatch Balance
description: Improves speed and stability under the bar
instructions: 3-4 sets of 3 reps @ 70-80% of snatch 1RM. Focus on quick drop and strong lockout.

name: Overhead Squat
description: Builds snatch receiving position strength and mobility
instructions: 3 sets of 5 reps @ 60-75% of snatch. Keep torso upright and brace.

name: Clean Pull
description: Develops leg drive and bar path for the clean
instructions: 4 sets of 3 reps @ 90-110% of clean. Stay over the bar and drive vertically.

name: Snatch Pull
instructions: 3-5 sets of 3 reps @ 90-100% of snatch. Full extension with elbows high.

name: Clean Front Squat
instructions: 3-4 sets of 3-5 reps @ 80-90% of front squat. Maintain clean rack position.

name: Jerk Dip + Drive
description: Improves dip and drive mechanics for the jerk
instructions: 3 sets of 5 reps @ 60-70% of jerk. Controlled dip and aggressive drive.

name: Tall Snatch
instructions: 3 sets of 3 reps with empty bar or light weight. Pull under aggressively.

name: Snatch High Pull
description: Develops explosive extension and upper pull
instructions: 3-4 sets of 3 reps @ 80-90% of snatch. Elbows above bar, strong finish.

name: Push Jerk
instructions: Dip and drive the bar overhead, then quickly re-dip under it with locked arms and stand to finish.

name: Split Jerk
instructions: Dip, drive and split one foot forward and the other back while punching the bar overhead.

name: Push Press
instructions: Dip slightly and drive the bar overhead with leg drive. Lockout with arms straight overhead.

name: Behind Neck Push Press
instructions: Dip and drive the bar from behind the neck. Ensure mobility and control to avoid shoulder strain.
